docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For as long as most people here can remember, the intersection of Albany Avenue and Great Neck Road has been a neighborhood hangout and, all too often, a gathering place for trouble.

headline.main: On the Corner: Reign of Crack and Violence

docs.snippet: LEAD: For as long as most people here can remember, the intersection of Albany Avenue and Great Neck Road has been a neighborhood hangout and, all too often, a gathering place for trouble.

byline.original: By ERIC SCHMITT, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: EVERYONE WHO HITS BOTTOM seems able to pinpoint the moment it happened. Mine occurred during an agitated depression a year and a half ago. I woke up one night obsessively aware of the gun that lay in a box under my bed and of my desire to place that gun in my mouth and pull the trigger.
